alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Randolph (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 17 at 5:17PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Randolph and central Lawrence Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 517 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Annieville, or 7 miles west of Lake Charles State Park, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Pocahontas... Walnut Ridge... Hoxie... Black Rock... Lake Charles State Park... Imboden... College City... Portia... O`Kean... Annieville... Smithville... Powhatan... Whiskerville... Giles Spur... Shannon... Dicus... Elnora... Eaton... Lauratown... Fender... This includes US Highway 67 between mile markers 117 and 121. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
